category.name: AT Commands
category.description: Commands that configure radio modem parameters via an AT Command interface

category.name: Networking
category.description: Enable communications in a networked environment

setting.name: Destination Address
setting.description: Sets the address that identifies the destination of the RF packet. Only radio modems having matching addresses can communicate with each other.

setting.name: Channel
setting.description: Selects the hopping or single frequency channel on which radio modem communicates. These channels are not non-interfering.

setting.name: Address Mask
setting.description: Set address mask to configure local and global address space.

category.name: Serial Interface Options
category.description: Enable communications in a networked environment

setting.name: DO2 Configuration
setting.description: Select behavior of Digital Output 2 (CTS signal is pin 1 of OEM RF Module).

setting.name: DO3 Configuration
setting.description: Select behavior of Digital Outout 3 (RX LED signal - pin 7 of the OEM RF Module).

category.name: Non-AT Settable Parameters
category.description: Parameters that can be only programmed using MaxStream-provided XCite-CTU Software

category.name: AT Command Options
category.description: Commands that change AT command mode behavior

buffer_setting.name: Command Sequence Character
buffer_setting.description: Set the ASCII character to be used between Guard Times of the AT Command Mode Sequence (BT+CC+AT). The AT Command Mode Sequence transitions the radio modem to AT Command Mode (from Idle Mode).

buffer_setting.name: Guard Time After
buffer_setting.description: Set required DI pin silent time after the Command Sequence Characters of the AT Command Mode Sequence (BT+CC+AT). The silent time is used to prevent inadvertent entrance into AT Command Mode.

buffer_setting.name: Guard Time Before
buffer_setting.description: Set required DI pin silent time before the Command Sequence Characters of the AT Command Mode Sequence (BT+CC+AT). The silent time is used to prevent inadvertent entrance into AT Command Mode.

buffer_setting.name: Time before Exit AT Command Mode
buffer_setting.description: Set time period of inactivity (no valid commands received) after which the radio modem automatically exits from AT Command Mode and returns to Idle Mode.

category.name: Networking
category.description: Enable communications in a networked environment

buffer_setting.name: Modem VID
buffer_setting.description: Read radio modem VID (Vendor Identification Number). Only radio modems with matching VIDs can communicate with each other.

category.name: Serial Interfacing Options
category.description: Allows changes to module interfacing options

buffer_setting.name: Baud Rate
buffer_setting.description: Sets serial data rate (baud rate at which radio modem interfaces with host). Serial data rate is different than RF data rate which is fixed and set at the factory. If the serial data rate is set higher than the RF data rate, CTS may need to be observed to prevent DI buffer overrun.

buffer_setting.name: Number of Bits
buffer_setting.description: Sets number of data bits per character (bits between start and stop bits).

buffer_setting.name: Parity
buffer_setting.description: Select parity format. Settigns 0-4 transfer only 8 bits out the antenna port and generate the parity bit on the radio modem receiving side.

buffer_setting.name: DI2 Configuration
buffer_setting.description: Select function for Digital Input 2 (RTS/CMD signal - pin 5 of OEM RF Module).

buffer_setting.name: Software Flow Control
buffer_setting.description: Enables serial software flow control on the radio modem. (Hardware flow control (CTS) is on by default.

category.name: Sleep (Low Power)
category.description: Module can be put into Sleep Mode to reduce the amount of power consumed

buffer_setting.name: Wake-up Initializer Timer
buffer_setting.description: Set time of the Wake-up initializer used to wake remote radios that are in cyclic sleep. Time of Wake-up initializer should be longer than that of the remote radio's cyclic sleep cycle (SM 3-8).

buffer_setting.name: Pin Wake-up
buffer_setting.description: Enalbe pin wake-up from Cyclic Sleep Mode.

buffer_setting.name: Time before Wake-up Initializer
buffer_setting.description: Set time period of inactivity (no serial or RF data is sent or received) before a Wake-up Initializer is sent. Base radio tracks awake-status of remote radios. HT of base radio should be set shorter than ST of remote radios.

buffer_setting.name: Time before Sleep
buffer_setting.description: Set time period of inactivity (no serial or RF data is sent or received) before activating Sleep Mode. Use with Cyclic Sleep and Serial Port Sleep. (see SM Command).

category.name: Read-Only AT Commands
category.description: Commands that access read-only parameters set at factory

setting.name: Hardware Version
setting.description: Reads the hardware version of the XCite radio modem.

setting.name: Serial Number High
setting.description: Reads high 2 bytes of module serial number

setting.name: Serial Number Low
setting.description: Reads low 2 bytes of module serial number

setting.name: Firmware Version
setting.description: Read firmware version currently loaded on radio modem.

setting.name: Receive Signal Strength
setting.description: Returns the signal strength (in decibels) of the last received packet.
